text: <https://github.com/ds4dm/Tulip.jl> is a solver that also supports non Float64 types such as BigFloats.  This might help figuring out what types JuMP supports

text.text: <https://github.com/ds4dm/Tulip.jl> is a solver that also supports non Float64 types such as BigFloats.  This might help figuring out what types JuMP supports

text:
In JuMP, everything is Float64.
On the other hand, MathOptInterface supports arbitrary data types. In the case of Tulip, you can use, eg, BigFloat through MOI but not through JuMP.

elements.text:
In JuMP, everything is Float64.
On the other hand, MathOptInterface supports arbitrary data types. In the case of Tulip, you can use, eg, BigFloat through MOI but not through JuMP.

text: you can also use BigFloat's through Convex.jl :smile:

elements.text: you can also use BigFloat's through Convex.jl
